body:
### Neovim version (nvim -v)

v0.7.2

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

vim version: 8.2
yes, vim --clean
yes, vim -u DEFAULTS
**no, vim -u NONE**

### Operating system/version

Apple M1 Pro
macOS 12.5 Monterey(12.4 got this issue too)

### Terminal name/version

iTerm2 Build 3.4.16 & Terminal 2.12.7(445)

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color

### Installation

homebrew

### How to reproduce the issue

nvim --clean
:edit foo
press i into insert mode
<Command-v> paste a text about 100+ lines

### Expected behavior

paste 100+ lines correctly.

### Actual behavior

paste stuck maybe after 15 lines, but it's still ok to type alpha and number
while press \<esc>, shows `^[`
while press \<Backspace>, shows `^?`
while press \<C-v>, shows `^[99;5u`

comment_data.body: Does this happen for any 100+ lines text, or only some specific text?

> 

Any 100+ lines

I can reproduce it with the below linked text with no rc file `nvim -u NONE -U NONE -N -i NONE` (v0.7) 

https://pastebin.com/raw/7EX6ws3S

Steps to reproduce.

1. Copy/Paste the code in the above link

2. Open an existing file or new buffer

3. Enter insert mode (this is where the bug occurs)

4. Paste the code from the link from system clipboard (Cmd+V or Ctrl+V)

5. You will now be stuck in insert mode and there appears to be no way to exit.
Hmm, looks like this issue is only reproducible on some terminals. I am unable to reproduce it in kitty.

> Hmm, looks like this issue is only reproducible on some terminals. I am unable to reproduce it in kitty.

Edit: Wait.. nope, its happening for my in both iterm2, alacritty and the terminal that ships with macOs
Not for me. I am on an M1 mac

> Hmm, looks like this issue is only reproducible on some terminals. I am unable to reproduce it in kitty.

Yeah, I'm unable to reproduce on Ubuntu using alacritty
I cannot reproduce this on neovim version `NVIM v0.8.0-dev-878-g02e9b5a8ee` (latest commit) or 0.7.0 with Alacritty on Manjaro. (Followed @beauwilliams' steps.)
So it seems so far this has only been reproduced on macOS.
It would be interesting to see if the problem persists when pasting from the `"+` register (new buffer -> `"+p`).
Pasting from the unamed plus register is faster if anything :)
I cannot reproduce this on macOS (with iTerm2 3.5.0-beta6).

related: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/10865

~~Pasting in insert-mode has really bad performance because Vim insists on treating it like user input, subject to all the auto-indent options, etc.~~

~~We should instead treat it like we treat normal-mode paste: turn off all that crap. Then the bottleneck will be your terminal (on macOS, Terminal.app is still horribly slow when it feeds text via bracketed-paste, whereas kitty and others will be near-instant).~~

> Actual behavior
> paste stuck maybe after 15 lines, but it's still ok to type alpha and number while press <esc>, shows `^[` while press <Backspace>, shows `^?` while press <C-v>, shows `^[99;5u`

Oh, so this isn't a performance issue.

> Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?
> vim version: 8.2 yes,

If it also happens on Vim (which has a completely different bracketed-paste impl), it might be a shell configuration issue.

@charlielin  @beauwilliams please try in a shell (without tmux/screen) without your config / environment:

    env -i bash --norc --noprofile

> If it also happens on Vim (which has a completely different bracketed-paste impl), it might be a shell configuration issue.
> 
> @charlielin @beauwilliams please try in a shell (without tmux/screen) without your config / environment:
> 
> ```
> env -i bash --norc --noprofile
> ```

@justinmk 

A new test in a shell without my config / enviroment(`env -i bash --norc --noprofile`):
### vim version: 8.2
no, vim --clean
no, vim -u DEFAULTS
no, vim -u NONE
### nvim v0.7.2
**yes, /opt/homebrew/bin/nvim --clean**

> @charlielin are you able to reproduce the issue in Terminal.app or other terminals besides iTerm?

@justinmk yes, the behavior  in Terminal.app is as same as in iTerm.app

please try the following:

```lua
vim.paste = (function(overridden)
 return function(lines, phase)
   local f = io.open('foo.txt','a')
   f:write(tostring(phase))
   io.close(f)
   overridden(lines, phase)
 end
end)(vim.paste)
```

1. `:write foo.lua`
1. `:source`
2. paste some text that reproduces this issue
3. what are the contents of `foo.txt` ?

> Enter insert mode (this is where the bug occurs)

This _only_ happens in insert-mode? Not in normal-mode?
When stuck in bracketed paste mode it may be impossible to leave Insert mode to type a command.

> 



> > Enter insert mode (this is where the bug occurs)
> 
> This _only_ happens in insert-mode? Not in normal-mode?

Yes, only happens in insert-mode with cmd-v to paste text. It's ok to paste text in normal-mode with `p`.
Does it happen in Normal mode with Cmd-v?

> please try the following:
> 
> ```lua
> vim.paste = (function(overridden)
>  return function(lines, phase)
>    local f = io.open('foo.txt','a')
>    f:write(tostring(phase))
>    io.close(f)
>    overridden(lines, phase)
>  end
> end)(vim.paste)
> ```
> 
> 1. `:write foo.lua`
> 2. `:source`
> 3. paste some text that reproduces this issue
> 4. what are the contents of `foo.txt` ?

@justinmk 
foo.txt:
11222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222

> Does it happen in Normal mode with Cmd-v?

OH YES, It also happens in Normal mode with Cmd-v

> foo.txt:
> 11222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222

Weird. Is the OS/terminal sending very tiny chunks? Or is Nvim hitting an infinite loop--does it keep appending "2" forever until you kill the `nvim` process? Does `vim` behave the same way (check its CPU usage in something like `top`)?
"1" appearing twice without "3" appearing is also very strange. Maybe there is a data race?
It just prints 13 for me. I am on a similar machine as them (M1 air, macos 12.5, terminal.app) and same nvim version (0.7.2)

@ad-chaos are you seeing this bug? It should not happen if you are seeing "3"...

Can everyone try the latest development version? See the [Releases](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/releases/tag/nightly) page for pre-built downloads.
I am not seeing seeing this bug, I tried it in kitty and terminal.app with the version they were running at and on head.

> > foo.txt:
> > 11222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222222
> 
> Weird. Is the OS/terminal sending very tiny chunks? Or is Nvim hitting an infinite loop--does it keep appending "2" forever until you kill the `nvim` process? Does `vim` behave the same way (check its CPU usage in something like `top`)?

I think the output of `foo.txt` maybe is associated with the `esc` I press after stuck. Here is my test:
#### round 1
1. into insert-mode
2. paste 100+ lines text
3. nvim stuck and do not touch keyboard
4. close the iTerm.app
5. foo.txt: `1`

#### round 2
1. into insert-mode
2. paste 100+ lines text
3. nvim stuck and press `esc` once
4. close the iTerm.app
5. foo.txt: `122`

#### round 3
1. into insert-mode
2. paste 100+ lines text
3. nvim stuck and do press `esc` twice
4. close the iTerm.app
5. foo.txt: `12222`

#### round 4
1. into insert-mode
2. paste 100+ lines text
3. nvim stuck and do press `esc` thrice
4. close the iTerm.app
5. foo.txt: `1222222`

#### round 5
1. into insert-mode
2. paste 100+ lines text
3. nvim stuck and do not touch keyboard and wait for abount 60 seconds.
4. close the iTerm.app
5. foo.txt: `1`

My cpu is very normal.

> @ad-chaos are you seeing this bug? It should not happen if you are seeing "3"...
> 
> Can everyone try the latest development version? See the [Releases](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/releases/tag/nightly) page for pre-built downloads.

I tried this pre-built release version. Its behavior is as same as `0.7.2`. Shows `1` or `1222222...`

> #### round 1
> 1. into insert-mode
> 2. paste 100+ lines text
> 3. nvim stuck and do not touch keyboard
> 4. close the iTerm.app
> 5. foo.txt: `1`

Ok. Given that Vim behaves the same when its bracketed-paste support is enabled, this suggests a terminal or OS bug.

Only thing we can do is look for CTRL-C as a way to recover: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/10865

Sorry for delayed reply. Yes for me its only happening in insert mode. I've started to notice it more recently with a number of text snippets. I will try out the suggestion above now see if that makes a difference and let know if so
This also happens to me in vim. Can safely say for my case its not specific to neovim
Hello everyone, after I upgrade  operation system to version 12.5.1, the issue do not occur anymore.
I propose we close this then.

Still happening to me. I'm using MacOS Ventura 13.1 and nvim 0.8.0 installed from bob version manager for neovim. It does not happen on ```sh env -i bash --norc --noprofile ``` I'm currently updating to MacOS 13.2.

> It does not happen on
> 
> ```shell
> env -i bash --norc --noprofile
> ```

hmm...
Can confirm that this happens to me using zsh with iTerm on M1 mac, but does not happen when using a blank bash profile.
+1 M2, iterm2, zsh
@griffinbaker12 @kirilgorbachov what Nvim version exactly are you using

title: stuck while pasting large text
